item.title: Webscraping NHL Data with RSelenium, Part 1
item.description: I love hockey. I also love data science. What’s better than merging the two and learn how to use RSelenium in the process? A while ago, I wrote some web-scraping code to find the NHL standings as of Novermber 1st (roughly one month into the season). I was doing this in order to determine if a strong start to the season was related to end-of-season success. Fortunately, the website dropyourgloves.

item.title: Hello World
item.description: R Markdown This is my first post! This website was developed with R Markdown, Blogdown, Hugo, and served via Netlify. I tried hosting this on GitHub Pages, but had difficulty with Jekyll and the R Markdown format. Having read about Blogdown, I’m making the transition. So far this is great. I can embed R code like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.
